Does the photocatalytic performance of TNP-MOF outperform all the other MOF-based photocatalysts even under visible-light-driven conditions?
Is the AQE value of TNP-MOF at a wavelength of 760 nm higher than 2%?
Does the BET surface area of TNP-MOF decrease after 48 hours of photocatalytic test?
Is the crystallinity and porosity of TNP-MOF well maintained after the photocatalytic test?
What is the role of triethanolamine (TEOA) in the photocatalytic CO2 reduction process?
data.answer: TEOA acts as a sacrificial amine donor for reductive quenching of the excited state of the photocatalyst.

data.question: How does the use of NIR light irradiation affect the photostability of MOFs during photocatalytic CO2 reduction?
data.answer: Using low-energy NIR light irradiation can reduce the photodegradation of organic photosensitive units in MOFs.

data.question: What happens to the π-conjugated cation radical signal of TNP linker upon NIR light illumination according to in situ EPR measurements?
data.answer: The π-conjugated cation radical signal of TNP linker remains unaltered upon NIR light illumination.

data.question: What is the effect of CO2 exposure on the Zr clusters in TNP-MOF as observed in near ambient pressure XPS studies?
data.answer: Exposure to CO2 results in the appearance of new Zr 3d species, indicating interaction of CO2 with the Zr clusters in TNP-MOF.

data.question: What is the significance of the absorption band at around 550 nm observed in UV-Vis-NIR spectroelectrochemical measurements of TNP linker?
data.answer: The absorption band at around 550 nm signifies the generation of one-electron oxidized species of TNP.
